Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Th1 (T15 deleted thanatin analog, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid deletion, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (95.24%) toThanatinK=R: 15%, I=C=G=P: 10%.Chemical modification: C-C disulfide bond .Activity: active against E. coli HB 101 (MIC 0.64 uM), S. typhimurium (MIC 1.3 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 2.6 uM),  B. subtilis (MIC 5.2 uM), and  S. aureus (MIC 10.4 uM).In vitro toxicity: not hemo.lytic at 200 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Lee MK, Cha L, Lee SH, Hahm KS. 2002
Literature Information.Reference: J Biochem Mol Biol. 2002 May 31;35(3):291-6. doi: 10.5483/bmbrep.2002.35.3.291.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Role of amino acid residues within the disulfide loop of thanatin, a potent antibiotic peptide.
